isis.stitle: HYDRO-MAX™ BRAKE BOOSTER AND MASTER CYLINDER - BRAKING SYSTEM PRESSURE SPECIFICATIONS

svcproc.title: Braking System Pressure Chart
svcproc.para: Additional diagnosis may be accomplished by measuring the fluid pressure being generated at a brake caliper by the brake master cylinder. To check brake line pressure, install a 0 to 2,000 psi (0 to 13,800 kPa) gauge at a brake caliper.
Apply the brakes with ignition switch "OFF" (the engine NOT running). The backup pump should start and produce up to approximately 800 psi (5,515 kPa) line pressure at the brake caliper.

Operate the engine at idle until the power steering fluid reaches normal operating temperature of 125 to 135 degrees F, (52 to 57 degrees C). Check temperature by placing thermometer (Kent-Moore No. J-5421-02 or equivalent) into power steering pump reservoir. Apply brakes. The line pressure at the brake caliper should be able to reach approximately 1,800 psi (12,400 kPa).

Refer to GROUP 05 - STEERING in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the proper procedure to test the power steering pump. There should be about a 1:2 ratio between power steering pump pressure and master cylinder output pressure. If both power steering pump and master cylinder provide the specified pressures, inspect other hydraulic brake system components for cause of poor braking.
